artist: Artist: Ōkura Kōtō; Publisher: Hasegawa Sonokichi, Japanese, c. 1877-1905
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: horizontal ōban; naval battle scene; two figures stand on the balcony of a ship, right figure holds a sword in raised PR hand; plumes of smoke in LRQ, center right, and in URC at the top of the ship; flag/ red sun in URC; ship on the water in center right; burning ship surrounded by flames and smoke in ULQ; rising waves with scattered white dots of snow or ash throughout
inscription: on back, in LLC, in pencil: 03123662 011
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Illustrations of the Hostilities between Japan and Russia (Nichiro kōsen zue 日露交戰啚繪)
text: Retailed by Satō Tokujirō; sometimes erroneously numbered again as four 其四.
title: Part Five
